page.title: 10HOW BEWDLEY HAS CHANGED
page.content: Bewdley was at it's most prosperous in the Eighteenth century. It was a busy port, at the head of the navigable part of the{River Severn.} There were many local crafts and a large market. When the canal system bypassed{Bewdley}to{Stourport}this prosperity ceased. Nowadays Bewdley is a commuter town for the big Midland towns. Many people live here for the beautiful scenery and peace and quiet. It is also a tourist attraction with the{Wyre Forest,}the{Safari Park,}the river and steam railway. The Severn Valley Railway is the longest private railway in the country. It was started in 1971 ten years after the Bridgnorth line was closed down by British Railways.Because of the traffic congestion from commuters and tourists Bewdley has been fighting for many years for a bypass which has started.
